title: Exploring Linear Algebra Matrix Solutions: Understanding Types of Solution Sets

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational algebraic operations and equation-solving experience
context.additional_context: Learners are interested in applying matrix concepts to social phenomena to solve everyday problems

learning_goals: Visually represent and explain the relationship between the column spaces of coefficient and augmented matrices
The consistency/contradiction/infinite number of solutions for a system can be determined by matrix rank.
Real-world problems (population distribution, budget allocation, etc.) can be transformed into linear system models and solutions derived.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
